experience.company: The Herzen State Pedagogical University of Russia
experience.description:
I want to change my profession and become a developer for several reasons. 
First of all, this is my long-term dream. I like the software development. 
Secondly, the ability to create intellectual property that is relevant on a large scale. 
Third, daily practice (hence development) of the English language. 
Fourth, the developer profession removes territorial boundaries and you can work in any country in the World, regardless of the legal system. 
 
The work in a large company has taught me to actively interact with specialized specialists from other departments for solving daily tasks. 
A large number of tasks and tight deadlines have taught me to careful planning and prioritization. 
There are algorithms in law, too. Even the most complex case becomes simple and "transparent" when you analyze the every element of it.

I established my own company thanks to which I gained a huge experience in the law sector. Moreover, I have learnt how to communicate with customers, identify their needs and explain complex things in simple words. 
 
I created and maintained a multi-page personal website through my entire lawyer's career where I posted articles about successful cases. The site was hosted on a virtual hosting under the management of CMS Joomla (the first two years). Then it was transferred to the WordPress CMS.

additional.result: Using Python to Access Web Data
